author: The Telegraph
title: Moving house? This method could solve your problems
text: You have to admire the enterprise of Sarah and Adam Howard who transported their Georgian manor, brick by brick , from Calne, in Wiltshire, to Uley, in Gloucestershire, 30 miles away. • The best English villages That’s what I call moving house. Even now, I’m not entirely sure why they did it. Was it to avoid some tiresome neighbours? Or perhaps to save a few pounds of council tax? Is Wiltshire not posh enough? There have been a few stories about houses being re-located like this, and, now we know it can be done, it opens up exciting possibilities. • Famous buildings that have moved It could help with divorces; instead of selling the marital home and sharing the proceeds, divorcing couples could split the house into two semis and move one half a safe distance away. In some cases, couples might decide to stay together for the sake of the chimneys. Sarah and Adam Howard's house in Wiltshire before they had it dismantled (SWNS Group) A husband, noting that his wife has removed exactly half the tiles from the roof might get an inkling there was something wrong with his marriage. All it takes is a little ambition. Always wanted to live in the New Forest? Well, start dismantling your town house. • Is the New Forest the most underrated National Park in the country? (Or, perhaps, secretly re-plant some of the New Forest closer to your home.) Maybe you could get a 21st century Capability Brown to divert a river for you, or shift a hill a few feet to the left. In the street where I live, builders have been doing up one house for months and months. The skips come and go, lorries arrive with tons of materials, scaffolding clangs and drills jar the nerves. The New Forest (Alamy) For what it must be costing, I think the owners could have posted every single brick of the house by Royal Mail (first class) to some other spot in the country. I’d suggest it to them if I could think of a tactful way of putting it. I suppose I could tell them I’ve heard very good things about Uley. Follow @TeleGoodLife Follow @telegraph
